column4: which redirects you (this is explained on the ReportingBugs page)
Must be because I'm a bug-control member
most of xubuntu is in universe
Kikinaak is this what you are looking for? http://packages.ubuntu.com/precise-updates/linux-backports-modules-cw-3.3-3.2.0-31-generic

Not exactly. Kikinaak needs to download the .deb that that package depends on, put them on a USB device, and move them to the PC with the bad Wifi (as it has no reliable net) . I'm ensuring Kikinaak has all the packages required, not just the virtual/meta packages
the debs are at the bottom (amd64/i386)
I know. But that package is virtual. I'm also making sure the dependencies are listed for Kikinaak
It is listed as such in launchpad. Weird. It's only 2.6KB in the LP list
and its only deps are linux-image-3.2.0-31-generic and dpkg
maybe you found the meta package on lp?
I think I did... I got lost in all the cross-references :D
yes the linux-backports can be quite confusing (especially since you would think they would be in -backports but they are in -updates)
those multiple kernel versions in package names made me dizzy
